Class CRSUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.matsim.contrib.common.gis.CRSUtils

  • public class CRSUtils
extends Object
    Utility-class providing functionality related to coordinate reference systems.
    Author:
    illenberger

    • Method Detail

      • getCRS

        public static org.opengis.referencing.crs.CoordinateReferenceSystem getCRS(int srid)
        Retrieves the coordinate reference system from the EPSG database.
        Parameters:
        srid - the spatial reference id.
        Returns:
        a coordinate reference system.

      • getSRID

        public static int getSRID(org.opengis.referencing.crs.CoordinateReferenceSystem crs)
        Returns the spatial reference id for a given coordinate reference system. If the coordinate reference system has multiple identifiers one is randomly selected.
        Parameters:
        crs - a coordinate reference system.
        Returns:
        the spatial reference id for the coordinate reference system or 0 if the coordinate reference system has no identifiers.

      • findTransform

        public static org.opengis.referencing.operation.MathTransform findTransform(com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.Geometry source,
                                                                            com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.Geometry target)
        Determines the transformation from the coordinate reference system of source to the one of target.
        Parameters:
        source - a geometry.
        target - a geometry.
        Returns:
        a transformation or null if the transformation could not be determined.

      • transformPoint

        public static com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.Point transformPoint(com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.Point point,
                                                               org.opengis.referencing.operation.MathTransform transform)
        Creates a new point that is a transformed copy of the original point.
        Parameters:
        point - a the original point.
        transform - the transformation to be applied.
        Returns:
        a new transformed point.
